p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d12 per Marauder level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 12 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d12 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per Marauder level after 1st.

Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Shields. Weapons: Simple Lightweapons, Martial Lightweapons, Simple Blasters, Simple Vibroweapons, Martial Vibroweapons. Saving Throws: Strength and Constitution.
Skills. Choose 2 from Intimidation, Nature, Perception, Survival, Athletics.
Spell Save DC. 8 + Charisma modifier + Proficiency Bonus.

Rage. Rage is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. You gain 1 Rage when you take damage, when you become impaired, or when you miss an attack on your turn (maximum 1 Rage gain per turn). You always start with max Rage after any rest.

tr.td: Spellcasting, Rage, Force Push, Force Pull, Taunt, Reckless Attack, Minor Telekinesis

sheet.description: An aggressive Force warrior channeling rage and the dark side in combat.

setters.set: An aggressive Force warrior channeling rage and the dark side in combat.
Light armor, medium armor, shields, simple lightweapons, martial lightweapons, simple blasters, simple vibroweapons, martial vibroweapons

description.p: A Marauder's power comes from the dark side of the Force. You have learned to draw on this power to cast spells.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Marauder spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Marauder spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell Attack Modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Rage is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. You gain 1 Rage when you take damage, when you become impaired, or when you miss an attack on your turn (maximum 1 Rage gain per turn). You always start with max Rage after any rest.
Your Rage increases as you gain levels, as shown in the Rage column of the Marauder table.

sheet.description: You have {{rage:max}} Rage points. You gain 1 Rage when you take damage, when you become impaired, or when you miss an attack on your turn (max 1/turn).

description.p: 1 Rage, Casting Time: 1 Action; Range: Self; Components: Somatic; Duration: Instantaneous; Use the Force to push someone away. Each creature in a 15-foot line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and are pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. 15-foot line, Con save. Fail: 2d8 kinetic + pushed 10 feet. Success: half damage, not pushed. Extra Rage: +1d8 damage and +5 feet push per Rage (max half Marauder level).

description.p: 1 Rage, Casting Time: 1 Action; Range: Self; Components: Somatic; Duration: Instantaneous; Use the Force to pull someone toward you. Each creature within a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and is pulled 10 feet closer. On a successful save, the creature take half damage and isn't pulled. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage, increases the cone size by 5 feet, and pulls creatures an additional 5 feet.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. 15-foot cone, Con save. Fail: 2d8 kinetic + pulled 10 feet. Success: half damage, not pulled. Extra Rage: +1d8 damage, +5 feet cone, +5 feet pull per Rage (max half Marauder level).

description.p: Casting Time: 1 Bonus Action; Range: 60 feet; Components: Verbal; Duration: Instantaneous; Taunt an enemy you see within range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gets taunted so that when they try to attack anyone other than you, they have disadvantage. On a successful save, the creature isn't taunted.

sheet.description: Taunt an enemy within 60 feet. Wis save or they have disadvantage when attacking anyone other than you.

description.p: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. This grants you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

sheet.description: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. This grants you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

description.p: 1 Rage, Casting Time: 1 Action; Range: 45 feet; Components: Somatic; Duration: Concentration, Up to 1 round; You use the Force to manipulate a small or medium object, or a small creature, that you can see within range. You make an ability check using your Force ability, contested by the target's Strength check. On a success, you may suspend and/or move up to 30 feet or throw the target. If you choose to suspend the target, it remains suspended for the duration. If you throw the target, make a ranged Force attack with a range of 30/60 feet. On a hit, the target you throw at takes kinetic damage based on what is thrown: Small object: 2d4 kinetic damage, Medium object: 2d6 kinetic damage, Small creature: 1d4 kinetic damage. If a creature is thrown, the thrown small creature takes 1d8 + your Force ability modifier kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Force check vs target's Str. Success: suspend/move 30 feet or throw (30/60 range). Thrown object damage: Small 2d4, Medium 2d6, Small creature 1d4 to target + 1d8+mod to thrown creature.

description.p: At 2nd level, you choose a Lightsaber Form that defines your combat style: Makashi, Soresu, Ataru, Shien, Djem So, Niman, or Juyo. Your form grants you features at 2nd level.

1 Rage, Action; Make a ranged attack of 30/60 with your melee weapon using your Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls. If you are proficient with you weapon you add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), your range increases by 10/15 feet.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Ranged attack 30/60 with melee weapon using Dex. Proficiency bonus added if proficient. Extra Rage: +10/15 range per Rage (max half Marauder level).

description.p: 2 Rage, Casting Time: 1 Action; Range: Self; Components: Somatic; Duration: Instantaneous; Use the Force to push everyone around you away. Each creature within 5 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 energy damage and is pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 energy damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

sheet.description: 2 Rage. All within 5 feet Con save. Fail: 2d8 energy + pushed 10 feet. Success: half damage, not pushed. Extra Rage: +1d8 damage and +5 feet push per Rage (max half Marauder level).

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

2 Rage, Casting Time: 1 Action; Range: 30 feet; Components: Somatic; Duration: Concentration, Up to 3 rounds; Use the Force to choke a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 kinetic damage and is Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not incapacitated. Your next turn you must use a Bonus Action to choke again or the target is released. The target must make another Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d8 kinetic damage and is Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not Incapacitated. On your third turn using this ability you must use a Bonus Action one last time or the target is released. The target must make a last Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 kinetic damage, but is no longer Incapacitated. On a successful save, the target takes no damage and is not Incapacitated. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the ability deals an addional 1d6 kinetic damage per choke.

sheet.description: 2 Rage. Target Con save or 1d6 kinetic + Incapacitated. Must use Bonus Action on subsequent turns to continue. Round 2: 1d8 damage. Round 3: 2d6 damage and released. Extra Rage: +1d6 per choke per Rage (max half Marauder level).

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your speed increases by 10 feet when you aren't wearing heavy armor.

sheet.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet when you aren't wearing heavy armor.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can't be Frightened.

sheet.description: You can't be Frightened.

description.p: Starting at 7th level, you have advantage on initiative rolls.

sheet.description: You have advantage on initiative rolls.

description.p: 1 Rage, Casting Time: 1 Action; Range: 30 feet; Components: Somatic; Duration: Instantaneous; Use the Force to electrocute a target within range. On hit, deals 2d8 lightning damage. Per extra Rage spent, to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), the attack deals an additional 1d8 damage.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Ranged Force attack, 2d8 lightning damage. Extra Rage: +1d8 per Rage (max half Marauder level).

description.p: Starting at 9th level, you can consume 3 Rage to gain an extra Action on your turn.

sheet.description: Consume 3 Rage to gain an extra Action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, when you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature. You don't add your ability modifier to the damage.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a creature within 5 feet, make a melee weapon attack against them (no ability mod to damage).

description.p: Starting at 11th level, if you drop to 0 hit points, you can spend 1 Rage to make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you fall unconscious. On a successful save, your hit points become 2 × your Marauder level. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5 until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: If you drop to 0 HP, spend 1 Rage to make DC 10 Con save. Success: HP becomes 2 × Marauder level. DC increases by 5 each use until rest.

description.p: Casting Time: 1 Bonus Action; Range: 60 feet; Components: None; Duration: 2 rounds; Instill fear on a target by simply being there. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened until the end of its turn. On a successful save, the target is not affected.

sheet.description: Target within 60 feet Wis save or frightened until end of its turn.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative, you gain 2 Rage.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative, you gain 2 Rage.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you can make an unarmed strike against yourself and gain 2 Rage.

sheet.description: Make an unarmed strike against yourself and gain 2 Rage.

description.p: Starting at 18th level, if your total for a Strength check or Strength saving throw is less than your Strength score, you can use your Strength score instead of the total.

sheet.description: If your total for a Strength check or save is less than your Strength score, you can use your Strength score instead.

description.p: At 20th level, your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 25.

sheet.description: Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 25.

description.p: Makashi is a dueling form focused on precision and finesse. Practitioners gain the Dueling fighting style and learn to Riposte against their enemies.
You gain the Dueling Fighting Style.

sheet.description: You gain the Dueling Fighting Style.

description.p: 1 Rage, Reaction; When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. When a creature misses you with a melee attack, make a melee weapon attack against them.

description.p: Soresu is a defensive form designed to protect against all attacks. Practitioners learn to Block melee attacks and Deflect ranged attacks.
1 Rage, Reaction; Block to negate a melee attack that would have hit you.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Negate a melee attack that would have hit you.

description.p: 1 Rage, Reaction; Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Deflect a ranged attack (not sonic/kinetic) or Force Lightning while wielding a lightweapon.

description.p: Ataru is an aggressive acrobatic form. Practitioners learn to leap great distances and fall gracefully.

1 Rage, Action; Jump up to twice your movement and make a melee weapon attack. This does not provoke Opportunity Attacks. Per extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), you can jump an additional 5 feet.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Jump up to 2x movement and attack. No OA. Extra Rage: +5 feet per Rage (max half level).

description.p: 1 Rage, Reaction; Use the Force to slow yourself when falling, taking only half fall damage.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Take half fall damage.

description.p: Shien focuses on deflecting ranged attacks back at attackers. Practitioners learn to Redirect incoming attacks.

1 Rage, Reaction; Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to send a ranged attack that would have hit you to a creature. This counts as a ranged Force attack with the range of the incoming attack. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Redirect a ranged attack (not sonic/kinetic) or Force Lightning at a creature while wielding a lightweapon.

description.p: Djem So emphasizes brute strength and overpowering offense. Practitioners learn Passionate Strike and Deflect.
2 Rage, Action; Make a melee attack and gain advantage on that attack.

sheet.description: 2 Rage. Make a melee attack with advantage.

description.p: 1 Rage, Reaction; Must wield a lightweapon. Use the Force to deflect a ranged attack that would have hit you. This also works on Force Lightning abilities. This does not work against weapons that deal sonic or kinetic damage.

sheet.description: 1 Rage. Deflect a ranged attack (not sonic/kinetic) or Force Lightning while wielding a lightweapon.

description.p: Niman balances all aspects of combat. Practitioners can use Force Push and Force Pull as Bonus Actions.
You can use Force Push and Force Pull as Bonus Actions instead of Actions.

sheet.description: You can use Force Push and Force Pull as Bonus Actions.

description.p: Juyo is an aggressive form that channels raw emotion into devastating attacks. Practitioners learn Cyclone to unleash flurries of strikes.

2 Rage, Action; Make a flurry of attacks in one swift movement. You make two attacks that count as one attack against the same target. You roll both to hit. Per 2 extra Rage spent to a max of half your Marauder level (rounded up), you make an additional attack within that flurry.

sheet.description: 2 Rage. Make two attacks as one against the same target. Extra Rage: +1 attack per 2 Rage (max half level).
